Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

Usually a binder is considered a high affinity binder with a Kd<10^8 M, preferably a Kd<10^9 M, even more preferred is a Kd<10^10 M.
Yet, in an alternatively preferred embodiment the individual antigen binding affinities are of medium affinity, e.g. with a Kd of less than 10^6 M and up to 10^8 M, e.g. when binding to at least two antigens.

There are no sentences that meet the specified criteria. The text does not contain specific molecule names, bioactivity metrics (IC50, Ki, Kd, EC50), numeric values, and units together in the same sentence.
